thread.title: Comment on WATCH: ‘Moana’ Singer Auli’i Cravalho Hit by Flag During Oscar Performance by Anonymous
thread.title_full: Comment on WATCH: ‘Moana’ Singer Auli’i Cravalho Hit by Flag During Oscar Performance by Anonymous

author: Anonymous
title: Comment on WATCH: ‘Moana’ Singer Auli’i Cravalho Hit by Flag During Oscar Performance by Anonymous
text:
WATCH: ‘Moana’ Singer Auli’i Cravalho Hit by Flag During Oscar Performance Published Updated 9:53 pm EST, February 26, 2017 1 Comment By S.J. Prince 6.8k 
Auli’i Cravalho was performing her hit song from the Disney movie Moana for the Academy Awards tonight when she was struck in the head by a flag by a dancer behind her. 
Like a champ, Cravalho barely flinched and continued to sing. 
Cravalho, 16, is from Kohala, Hawaii and was selected to be the newest voice of a Disney princess after hundreds of auditions, reports the Huffington Post. Cravalho was one of the last actresses casting director Rachel Sutton saw before she was offered the title role. Cravalho starred with fellow voice actor Dwayne Johnson in the animated film, but her breakout moment in the movie was brought to her by Hamilton star and composer, Lin-Manuel Miranda, who wrote the song “How Far I’ll Go.” AULI'I CRAVALHO PERFORMING HOW FAR I'LL GO AT THE #Oscars pic.twitter.com/IAOxAFYzx3
